glsa.title: Blender: Untrusted search path
glsa.synopsis: An untrusted search path vulnerability in Blender might result in the execution of arbitrary code.

description.p: Steffen Joeris reported that Blender's BPY_interface calls PySys_SetArgv() in such a way that Python prepends sys.path with an empty string.

impact.p: A local attacker could entice a user to run "blender" from a directory containing a specially crafted Python module, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Blender users should upgrade to the latest version:
